summary.long: 1 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, called as an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who have been sanctified in Christ Jesus, saints by calling, with all who in every place call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, their Lord and ours:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God always concerning you for the grace of God which was given you in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in everything you were enriched in Him, in all speech and all knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as the testimony concerning Christ was confirmed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you are not lacking in any gift, awaiting eagerly the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will also confirm you to the end, blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is faithful, through whom you were called into fellowship with His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I exhort you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all agree and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be made complete in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have been informed concerning you, my brethren, by Chloe’s people, that there are quarrels among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I mean this, that each one of you is saying, “I am of Paul,” and “I of Apollos,” and “I of Cephas,” and “I of Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has Christ been divided? Paul was not crucified for you, was he? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one would say you were baptized in my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I did baptize also the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I do not know whether I baptized any other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not in cleverness of speech, so that the cross of Christ would not be made void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written,
“I will destroy the wisdom of the wise,
And the cleverness of the clever I will set aside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the wise man? Where is the scribe? Where is the debater of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not come to know God, God was well-pleased through the foolishness of the message preached to save those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed Jews ask for signs and Greeks search for wisdom;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we preach Christ crucified, to Jews a stumbling block and to Gentiles foolishness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to those who are the called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For consider your calling, brethren, that there were not many wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God has chosen the foolish things of the world to shame the wise, and God has chosen the weak things of the world to shame the things which are strong,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the base things of the world and the despised God has chosen, the things that are not, so that He may nullify the things that are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no man may boast before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by His doing you are in Christ Jesus, who became to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification, and redemption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that, just as it is written, “Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I came to you, brethren, I did not come with superiority of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I determined to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ, and Him crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my message and my preaching were not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your faith would not rest on the wisdom of men, but on the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet we do speak wisdom among those who are mature; a wisdom, however, not of this age nor of the rulers of this age, who are passing away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we speak God’s wisdom in a mystery, the hidden wisdom which God predestined before the ages to our glory;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the wisdom which none of the rulers of this age has understood; for if they had understood it they would not have crucified the Lord of glory;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but just as it is written,
“Things which eye has not seen and ear has not heard,
And which have not entered the heart of man,
All that God has prepared for those who love Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to us God revealed them through the Spirit; for the Spirit searches all things, even the depths of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who among men knows the thoughts of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? Even so the thoughts of God no one knows except the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may know the things freely given to us by God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things we also speak, not in words taught by human wisdom, but in those taught by the Spirit, combining spiritual thoughts with spiritual words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a natural man does not accept the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually appraised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is spiritual appraises all things, yet he himself is appraised by no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord, that he will instruct Him? But we have the mind of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual men, but as to men of flesh, as to infants in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave you milk to drink, not solid food; for you were not yet able to receive it. Indeed, even now you are not yet able,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are still fleshly. For since there is jealousy and strife among you, are you not fleshly, and are you not walking like mere men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when one says, “I am of Paul,” and another, “I am of Apollos,” are you not mere men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then is Apollos? And what is Paul? Servants through whom you believed, even as the Lord gave opportunity to each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I planted, Apollos watered, but God was causing the growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but God who causes the growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who plants and he who waters are one; but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are God’s fellow workers; you are God’s field, God’s building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the grace of God which was given to me, like a wise master builder I laid a foundation, and another is building on it. But each man must be careful how he builds on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no man can lay a foundation other than the one which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if any man builds on the foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, straw,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each man’s work will become evident; for the day will show it because it is to be revealed with fire, and the fire itself will test the quality of each man’s work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man’s work which he has built on it remains, he will receive a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man’s work is burned up, he will suffer loss; but he himself will be saved, yet so as through fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that you are a temple of God and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man destroys the temple of God, God will destroy him, for the temple of God is holy, and that is what you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you thinks that he is wise in this age, he must become foolish, so that he may become wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness before God. For it is written, “He is the one who catches the wise in their craftiness”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and again, “The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise, that they are useless.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then let no one boast in men. For all things belong to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things to come; all things belong to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you belong to Christ; and Christ belongs to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a man regard us in this manner, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this case, moreover, it is required of stewards that one be found trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to me it is a very small thing that I may be examined by you, or by any human court; in fact, I do not even examine myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am conscious of nothing against myself, yet I am not by this acquitted; but the one who examines me is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not go on passing judgment before the time, but wait until the Lord comes who will both bring to light the things hidden in the darkness and disclose the motives of men’s hearts; and then each man’s praise will come to him from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things, brethren, I have figuratively applied to myself and Apollos for your sakes, so that in us you may learn not to exceed what is written, so that no one of you will become arrogant in behalf of one against the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who regards you as superior? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you did receive it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are already filled, you have already become rich, you have become kings without us; and indeed, I wish that you had become kings so that we also might reign with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, I think, God has exhibited us apostles last of all, as men condemned to death; because we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are prudent in Christ; we are weak, but you are strong; you are distinguished, but we are without honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this present hour we are both hungry and thirsty, and are poorly clothed, and are roughly treated, and are homeless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we toil, working with our own hands; when we are reviled, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when we are slandered, we try to conciliate; we have become as the scum of the world, the dregs of all things, even until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not write these things to shame you, but to admonish you as my beloved children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you were to have countless tutors in Christ, yet you would not have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I exhort you, be imitators of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I have sent to you Timothy, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, and he will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, just as I teach everywhere in every church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some have become arrogant, as though I were not coming to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will come to you soon, if the Lord wills, and I shall find out, not the words of those who are arrogant but their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of God does not consist in words but in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do you desire? Shall I come to you with a rod, or with love and a spirit of gentleness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is actually reported that there is immorality among you, and immorality of such a kind as does not exist even among the Gentiles, that someone has his father’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have become arrogant and have not mourned instead, so that the one who had done this deed would be removed from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I, on my part, though absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged him who has so committed this, as though I were present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the name of our Lord Jesus, when you are assembled, and I with you in spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have decided to deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of his flesh, so that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Clean out the old leaven so that you may be a new lump, just as you are in fact unleavened. For Christ our Passover also has been sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote you in my letter not to associate with immoral people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not at all mean with the immoral people of this world, or with the covetous and swindlers, or with idolaters, for then you would have to go out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But actually, I wrote to you not to associate with any so-called brother if he is an immoral person, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or a swindler—not even to eat with such a one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what have I to do with judging outsiders? Do you not judge those who are within the church?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who are outside, God judges. Remove the wicked man from among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does any one of you, when he has a case against his neighbor, dare to go to law before the unrighteous and not before the saints?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that the saints will judge the world? If the world is judged by you, are you not competent to constitute the smallest law courts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that we will judge angels? How much more matters of this life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you have law courts dealing with matters of this life, do you appoint them as judges who are of no account in the church?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say this to your shame. Is it so, that there is not among you one wise man who will be able to decide between his brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but brother goes to law with brother, and that before unbelievers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Actually, then, it is already a defeat for you, that you have lawsuits with one another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, you yourselves wrong and defraud. You do this even to your brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived; neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor homosexuals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor thieves, nor the covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor swindlers, will inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such were some of you; but you were washed, but you were sanctified, but you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are lawful for me, but not all things are profitable. All things are lawful for me, but I will not be mastered by anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food, but God will do away with both of them. Yet the body is not for immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now God has not only raised the Lord, but will also raise us up through His power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take away the members of Christ and make them members of a prostitute? May it never be!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that the one who joins himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For He says, “The two shall become one flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who joins himself to the Lord is one spirit with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flee immorality. Every other sin that a man commits is outside the body, but the immoral man sins against his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have been bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the things about which you wrote, it is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because of immoralities, each man is to have his own wife, and each woman is to have her own husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husband must fulfill his duty to his wife, and likewise also the wife to her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does; and likewise also the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop depriving one another, except by agreement for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer, and come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I say by way of concession, not of command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I wish that all men were even as I myself am. However, each man has his own gift from God, one in this manner, and another in that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to the unmarried and to widows that it is good for them if they remain even as I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not have self-control, let them marry; for it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the married I give instructions, not I, but the Lord, that the wife should not leave her husband
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (but if she does leave, she must remain unmarried, or else be reconciled to her husband), and that the husband should not divorce his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the rest I say, not the Lord, that if any brother has a wife who is an unbeliever, and she consents to live with him, he must not divorce her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman who has an unbelieving husband, and he consents to live with her, she must not send her husband away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified through her believing husband; for otherwise your children are unclean, but now they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if the unbelieving one leaves, let him leave; the brother or the sister is not under bondage in such cases, but God has called us to peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, as the Lord has assigned to each one, as God has called each, in this manner let him walk. And so I direct in all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was any man called when he was already circumcised? He is not to become uncircumcised. Has anyone been called in uncircumcision? He is not to be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but what matters is the keeping of the commandments of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each man must remain in that condition in which he was called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were you called while a slave? Do not worry about it; but if you are able also to become free, rather do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who was called in the Lord while a slave, is the Lord’s freedman; likewise he who was called while free, is Christ’s slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were bought with a price; do not become slaves of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, each one is to remain with God in that condition in which he was called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning virgins I have no command of the Lord, but I give an opinion as one who by the mercy of the Lord is trustworthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I think then that this is good in view of the present distress, that it is good for a man to remain as he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you bound to a wife? Do not seek to be released. Are you released from a wife? Do not seek a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Yet such will have trouble in this life, and I am trying to spare you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I say, brethren, the time has been shortened, so that from now on those who have wives should be as though they had none;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those who weep, as though they did not weep; and those who rejoice, as though they did not rejoice; and those who buy, as though they did not possess;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those who use the world, as though they did not make full use of it; for the form of this world is passing away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I want you to be free from concern. One who is unmarried is concerned about the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one who is married is concerned about the things of the world, how he may please his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his interests are divided. The woman who is unmarried, and the virgin, is concerned about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and spirit; but one who is married is concerned about the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I say for your own benefit; not to put a restraint upon you, but to promote what is appropriate and to secure undistracted devotion to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any man thinks that he is acting unbecomingly toward his virgin daughter, if she is past her youth, and if it must be so, let him do what he wishes, he does not sin; let her marry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who stands firm in his heart, being under no constraint, but has authority over his own will, and has decided this in his own heart, to keep his own virgin daughter, he will do well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then both he who gives his own virgin daughter in marriage does well, and he who does not give her in marriage will do better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wife is bound as long as her husband lives; but if her husband is dead, she is free to be married to whom she wishes, only in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in my opinion she is happier if she remains as she is; and I think that I also have the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning things sacrificed to idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge makes arrogant, but love edifies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone supposes that he knows anything, he has not yet known as he ought to know;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if anyone loves God, he is known by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore concerning the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that there is no such thing as an idol in the world, and that there is no God but one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even if there are so-called gods whether in heaven or on earth, as indeed there are many gods and many lords,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom are all things and we exist for Him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we exist through Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However not all men have this knowledge; but some, being accustomed to the idol until now, eat food as if it were sacrificed to an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But food will not commend us to God; we are neither the worse if we do not eat, nor the better if we do eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take care that this liberty of yours does not somehow become a stumbling block to the weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone sees you, who have knowledge, dining in an idol’s temple, will not his conscience, if he is weak, be strengthened to eat things sacrificed to idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through your knowledge he who is weak is ruined, the brother for whose sake Christ died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so, by sinning against the brethren and wounding their conscience when it is weak, you sin against Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will never eat meat again, so that I will not cause my brother to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If to others I am not an apostle, at least I am to you; for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My defense to those who examine me is this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we not have a right to eat and drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we not have a right to take along a believing wife, even as the rest of the apostles and the brothers of the Lord and Cephas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do only Barnabas and I not have a right to refrain from working?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who at any time serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat the fruit of it? Or who tends a flock and does not use the milk of the flock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not speaking these things according to human judgment, am I? Or does not the Law also say these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the Law of Moses, “You shall not muzzle the ox while he is threshing.” God is not concerned about oxen, is He?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or is He speaking altogether for our sake? Yes, for our sake it was written, because the plowman ought to plow in hope, and the thresher to thresh in hope of sharing the crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we sowed spiritual things in you, is it too much if we reap material things from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If others share the right over you, do we not more? Nevertheless, we did not use this right, but we endure all things so that we will cause no hindrance to the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that those who perform sacred services eat the food of the temple, and those who attend regularly to the altar have their share from the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also the Lord directed those who proclaim the gospel to get their living from the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have used none of these things. And I am not writing these things so that it will be done so in my case; for it would be better for me to die than have any man make my boast an empty one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast of, for I am under compulsion; for woe is me if I do not preach the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I do this voluntarily, I have a reward; but if against my will, I have a stewardship entrusted to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then is my reward? That, when I preach the gospel, I may offer the gospel without charge, so as not to make full use of my right in the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am free from all men, I have made myself a slave to all, so that I may win more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Jews I became as a Jew, so that I might win Jews; to those who are under the Law, as under the Law though not being myself under the Law, so that I might win those who are under the Law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those who are without law, as without law, though not being without the law of God but under the law of Christ, so that I might win those who are without law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the weak I became weak, that I might win the weak; I have become all things to all men, so that I may by all means save some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do all things for the sake of the gospel, so that I may become a fellow partaker of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know that those who run in a race all run, but only one receives the prize? Run in such a way that you may win.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who competes in the games exercises self-control in all things. They then do it to receive a perishable wreath, but we an imperishable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I run in such a way, as not without aim; I box in such a way, as not beating the air;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I discipline my body and make it my slave, so that, after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not want you to be unaware, brethren, that our fathers were all under the cloud and all passed through the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all ate the same spiritual food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they were drinking from a spiritual rock which followed them; and the rock was Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, with most of them God was not well-pleased; for they were laid low in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things happened as examples for us, so that we would not crave evil things as they also craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink, and stood up to play.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor let us act immorally, as some of them did, and twenty-three thousand fell in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor let us try the Lord, as some of them did, and were destroyed by the serpents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor grumble, as some of them did, and were destroyed by the destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things happened to them as an example, and they were written for our instruction, upon whom the ends of the ages have come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed that he does not fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No temptation has overtaken you but such as is common to man; and God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will provide the way of escape also, so that you will be able to endure it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak as to wise men; you judge what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the cup of blessing which we bless a sharing in the blood of Christ? Is not the bread which we break a sharing in the body of Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since there is one bread, we who are many are one body; for we all partake of the one bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at the nation Israel; are not those who eat the sacrifices sharers in the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do I mean then? That a thing sacrificed to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, but I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons and not to God; and I do not want you to become sharers in demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the table of the Lord and the table of demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? We are not stronger than He, are we?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are lawful, but not all things are profitable. All things are lawful, but not all things edify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one seek his own good, but that of his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat anything that is sold in the meat market without asking questions for conscience’ sake;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the earth is the Lord’s, and all it contains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one of the unbelievers invites you and you want to go, eat anything that is set before you without asking questions for conscience’ sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone says to you, “This is meat sacrificed to idols,” do not eat it, for the sake of the one who informed you, and for conscience’ sake;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I mean not your own conscience, but the other man’s; for why is my freedom judged by another’s conscience?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I slandered concerning that for which I give thanks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether, then, you eat or drink or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give no offense either to Jews or to Greeks or to the church of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit but the profit of the many, so that they may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be imitators of me, just as I also am of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I praise you because you remember me in everything and hold firmly to the traditions, just as I delivered them to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I want you to understand that Christ is the head of every man, and the man is the head of a woman, and God is the head of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man who has something on his head while praying or prophesying disgraces his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every woman who has her head uncovered while praying or prophesying disgraces her head, for she is one and the same as the woman whose head is shaved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if a woman does not cover her head, let her also have her hair cut off; but if it is disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, let her cover her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a man ought not to have his head covered, since he is the image and glory of God; but the woman is the glory of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For man does not originate from woman, but woman from man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for indeed man was not created for the woman’s sake, but woman for the man’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the woman ought to have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, in the Lord, neither is woman independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the woman originates from the man, so also the man has his birth through the woman; and all things originate from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge for yourselves: is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her? For her hair is given to her for a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if one is inclined to be contentious, we have no other practice, nor have the churches of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in giving this instruction, I do not praise you, because you come together not for the better but for the worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, in the first place, when you come together as a church, I hear that divisions exist among you; and in part I believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there must also be factions among you, so that those who are approved may become evident among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when you meet together, it is not to eat the Lord’s Supper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in your eating each one takes his own supper first; and one is hungry and another is drunk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What! Do you not have houses in which to eat and drink? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you? In this I will not praise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I received from the Lord that which I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus in the night in which He was betrayed took bread;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when He had given thanks, He broke it and said, “This is My body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way He took the cup also after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood; do this, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as often as you eat this bread and drink the cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until He comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner, shall be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a man must examine himself, and in so doing he is to eat of the bread and drink of the cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who eats and drinks, eats and drinks judgment to himself if he does not judge the body rightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason many among you are weak and sick, and a number sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we judged ourselves rightly, we would not be judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when we are judged, we are disciplined by the Lord so that we will not be condemned along with the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, so that you will not come together for judgment. The remaining matters I will arrange when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I do not want you to be unaware.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that when you were pagans, you were led astray to the mute idols, however you were led.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus is accursed”; and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there are varieties of gifts, but the same Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there are varieties of ministries, and the same Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are varieties of effects, but the same God who works all things in all persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to each one is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the common good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to one is given the word of wisdom through the Spirit, and to another the word of knowledge according to the same Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another faith by the same Spirit, and to another gifts of healing by the one Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to another the effecting of miracles, and to another prophecy, and to another the distinguishing of spirits, to another various kinds of tongues, and to another the interpretation of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one and the same Spirit works all these things, distributing to each one individually just as He wills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even as the body is one and yet has many members, and all the members of the body, though they are many, are one body, so also is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether slaves or free, and we were all made to drink of one Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the body is not one member, but many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the foot says, “Because I am not a hand, I am not a part of the body,” it is not for this reason any the less a part of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the ear says, “Because I am not an eye, I am not a part of the body,” it is not for this reason any the less a part of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were hearing, where would the sense of smell be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now God has placed the members, each one of them, in the body, just as He desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they were all one member, where would the body be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now there are many members, but one body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you”; or again the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, it is much truer that the members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those members of the body which we deem less honorable, on these we bestow more abundant honor, and our less presentable members become much more presentable,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas our more presentable members have no need of it. But God has so composed the body, giving more abundant honor to that member which lacked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that there may be no division in the body, but that the members may have the same care for one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are Christ’s body, and individually members of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God has appointed in the church, first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, various kinds of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All are not apostles, are they? All are not prophets, are they? All are not teachers, are they? All are not workers of miracles, are they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All do not have gifts of healings, do they? All do not speak with tongues, do they? All do not interpret, do they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But earnestly desire the greater gifts.
And I show you a still more excellent way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but do not have love, I have become a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I give all my possessions to feed the poor, and if I surrender my body to be burned, but do not have love, it profits me nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love is patient, love is kind and is not jealous; love does not brag and is not arrogant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: does not act unbecomingly; it does not seek its own, is not provoked, does not take into account a wrong suffered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: does not rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love never fails; but if there are gifts of prophecy, they will be done away; if there are tongues, they will cease; if there is knowledge, it will be done away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know in part and we prophesy in part;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when the perfect comes, the partial will be done away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was a child, I used to speak like a child, think like a child, reason like a child; when I became a man, I did away with childish things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we see in a mirror dimly, but then face to face; now I know in part, but then I will know fully just as I also have been fully known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now faith, hope, love, abide these three; but the greatest of these is love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pursue love, yet desire earnestly spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For one who speaks in a tongue does not speak to men but to God; for no one understands, but in his spirit he speaks mysteries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one who prophesies speaks to men for edification and exhortation and consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One who speaks in a tongue edifies himself; but one who prophesies edifies the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I wish that you all spoke in tongues, but even more that you would prophesy; and greater is one who prophesies than one who speaks in tongues, unless he interprets, so that the church may receive edifying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, brethren, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what will I profit you unless I speak to you either by way of revelation or of knowledge or of prophecy or of teaching?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even lifeless things, either flute or harp, in producing a sound, if they do not produce a distinction in the tones, how will it be known what is played on the flute or on the harp?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the bugle produces an indistinct sound, who will prepare himself for battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, unless you utter by the tongue speech that is clear, how will it be known what is spoken? For you will be speaking into the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are, perhaps, a great many kinds of languages in the world, and no kind is without meaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then I do not know the meaning of the language, I will be to the one who speaks a barbarian, and the one who speaks will be a barbarian to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, since you are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek to abound for the edification of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let one who speaks in a tongue pray that he may interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is the outcome then? I will pray with the spirit and I will pray with the mind also; I will sing with the spirit and I will sing with the mind also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise if you bless in the spirit only, how will the one who fills the place of the ungifted say the “Amen” at your giving of thanks, since he does not know what you are saying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are giving thanks well enough, but the other person is not edified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God, I speak in tongues more than you all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: however, in the church I desire to speak five words with my mind so that I may instruct others also, rather than ten thousand words in a tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, do not be children in your thinking; yet in evil be infants, but in your thinking be mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Law it is written, “By men of strange tongues and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people, and even so they will not listen to Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe but to unbelievers; but prophecy is for a sign, not to unbelievers but to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if the whole church assembles together and all speak in tongues, and ungifted men or unbelievers enter, will they not say that you are mad?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or an ungifted man enters, he is convicted by all, he is called to account by all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the secrets of his heart are disclosed; and so he will fall on his face and worship God, declaring that God is certainly among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is the outcome then, brethren? When you assemble, each one has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a tongue, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks in a tongue, it should be by two or at the most three, and each in turn, and one must interpret;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if there is no interpreter, he must keep silent in the church; and let him speak to himself and to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others pass judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a revelation is made to another who is seated, the first one must keep silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you can all prophesy one by one, so that all may learn and all may be exhorted;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the spirits of prophets are subject to prophets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for God is not a God of confusion but of peace, as in all the churches of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women are to keep silent in the churches; for they are not permitted to speak, but are to subject themselves, just as the Law also says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they desire to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is improper for a woman to speak in church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was it from you that the word of God first went forth? Or has it come to you only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone thinks he is a prophet or spiritual, let him recognize that the things which I write to you are the Lord’s commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone does not recognize this, he is not recognized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my brethren, desire earnestly to prophesy, and do not forbid to speak in tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all things must be done properly and in an orderly manner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I make known to you, brethren, the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received, in which also you stand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by which also you are saved, if you hold fast the word which I preached to you, unless you believed in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I delivered to you as of first importance what I also received, that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He was buried, and that He was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that He appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that He appeared to more than five hundred brethren at one time, most of whom remain until now, but some have fallen asleep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then He appeared to James, then to all the apostles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and last of all, as to one untimely born, He appeared to me also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the least of the apostles, and not fit to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace toward me did not prove vain; but I labored even more than all of them, yet not I, but the grace of God with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether then it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if Christ is preached, that He has been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, not even Christ has been raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is vain, your faith also is vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover we are even found to be false witnesses of God, because we testified against God that He raised Christ, whom He did not raise, if in fact the dead are not raised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the dead are not raised, not even Christ has been raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if Christ has not been raised, your faith is worthless; you are still in your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have hoped in Christ in this life only, we are of all men most to be pitied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now Christ has been raised from the dead, the first fruits of those who are asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since by a man came death, by a man also came the resurrection of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each in his own order: Christ the first fruits, after that those who are Christ’s at His coming,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then comes the end, when He hands over the kingdom to the God and Father, when He has abolished all rule and all authority and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He must reign until He has put all His enemies under His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The last enemy that will be abolished is death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He has put all things in subjection under His feet. But when He says, “All things are put in subjection,” it is evident that He is excepted who put all things in subjection to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all things are subjected to Him, then the Son Himself also will be subjected to the One who subjected all things to Him, so that God may be all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, what will those do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why then are they baptized for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are we also in danger every hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I affirm, brethren, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If from human motives I fought with wild beasts at Ephesus, what does it profit me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be deceived: “Bad company corrupts good morals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Become sober-minded as you ought, and stop sinning; for some have no knowledge of God. I speak this to your shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body do they come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fool! That which you sow does not come to life unless it dies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that which you sow, you do not sow the body which is to be, but a bare grain, perhaps of wheat or of something else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God gives it a body just as He wished, and to each of the seeds a body of its own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another flesh of birds, and another of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are also heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, but the glory of the heavenly is one, and the glory of the earthly is another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for star differs from star in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown a perishable body, it is raised an imperishable body;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living soul.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural; then the spiritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first man is from the earth, earthy; the second man is from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As is the earthy, so also are those who are earthy; and as is the heavenly, so also are those who are heavenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as we have borne the image of the earthy, we will also bear the image of the heavenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say this, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I tell you a mystery; we will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this perishable must put on the imperishable, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this perishable will have put on the imperishable, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then will come about the saying that is written, “Death is swallowed up in victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O death, where is your victory? O death, where is your sting?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your toil is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I directed the churches of Galatia, so do you also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of every week each one of you is to put aside and save, as he may prosper, so that no collections be made when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I arrive, whomever you may approve, I will send them with letters to carry your gift to Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it is fitting for me to go also, they will go with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will come to you after I go through Macedonia, for I am going through Macedonia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and perhaps I will stay with you, or even spend the winter, so that you may send me on my way wherever I may go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I do not wish to see you now just in passing; for I hope to remain with you for some time, if the Lord permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will remain in Ephesus until Pentecost;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a wide door for effective service has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if Timothy comes, see that he is with you without cause to be afraid, for he is doing the Lord’s work, as I also am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let no one despise him. But send him on his way in peace, so that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning Apollos our brother, I encouraged him greatly to come to you with the brethren; and it was not at all his desire to come now, but he will come when he has opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on the alert, stand firm in the faith, act like men, be strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all that you do be done in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I urge you, brethren (you know the household of Stephanas, that they were the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves for ministry to the saints),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you also be in subjection to such men and to everyone who helps in the work and labors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoice over the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus, because they have supplied what was lacking on your part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge such men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Prisca greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brethren greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The greeting is in my own hand—Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not love the Lord, he is to be accursed. Maranatha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
